description: The product of the political process is public policy. This course surveys the major areas of domestic public policy in the United States: education, welfare, health, housing, the environment, and the economy with special attention to the impact of public policies on women and minorities. Also counts toward business and management studies concentration. Prerequisite: one course in political science or permission of instructor.
name: Introduction to Public Policy
notes: This course includes an academic civic engagement (ACE) component.
prerequisites: one course in political science or permission of instructor.
